title: "Omg OFA picks from the shared champ pool, I only want to play my own champs"
body:
Said no one ever.

Why would they say so in ARAM then?

Make ARAM truely random by using the entire champ pool for everyone.

replies.body: Pretty good analogy. I don't think that people mind that they can get eachother's champs. More so, I think that many people like trying out those champs without having to wait for free week. I certainly enjoyed playing some champs I didn't own last time it was OFA.

mfw I own all champs and someone always deems my 20% hat in the ring as "_troll_"

http://i.imgur.com/6xkQgXL.gif?Noredirect

And one for all singed is not troll?

EDIT: I played OFA singed jg. Into a thresh.

Per _your_ definition of "troll"? Perhaps it is. 

Per _my_ definition? Not so much. 

Our specie is specially capable of disagreeing over arbitrary things, the above being a good demonstration of such. 

http://i.imgur.com/ZO3rR5L.gif?Noredirect
OFA Singed is troll?
A good example of this exact thing happening: I got to try out Zyra, who I don't own. It was fun as hell.

I think it's because OFA is a limited time game mode, whereas ARAM is permanent. Riot worries that people would use ARAM to test champs without buying them or waiting for free week, cutting into RP sales.

That being said the ARAM accounts are getting out of control and I would actually like if all champs were unlocked.

> [{quoted}](name=Jelly Mac,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Tg9gZAal,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2016-08-09T01:56:48.616+0000)

but at the same time, trying champs you never would have bought may make you go "wow, this dude was a lot of fun" and decide to buy them with RP, or actually get motivated to spend your IP on it and buy skins for them.

That's what the free week rotation does already.
It's hard to test champs when it's a less than 1% chance of getting them every game. Besides, many people have the IP to instabuy new champs anyways.

Key difference: In One For All I'm picking. At worst I have a 20% chance that I'll be playing something I want to. Even if I'm out-voted, there's *someone* on my team who knows that champion.

ARAM offers none of those fall back safety mechanics. 

Instead of complaining about ARAM Smurfs you're going to be complaining about players who have no idea how to play 75%+ of the champions, costing you game after game.

I think your missing the point of Aram,  it's supposed to be an unbalanced mess full of people first timing champions, that's what makes it fun. What's not fun is rolling a tryndamere on your main account on which you have 120 champions against 5 Aram only accounts which rolled Veigar, lux,  ziggs, wukong , and your choice of Adc or Soraka.

1- Soraka is garbage fyi.

2- unlocking all champions won't change that, you will still be rolling Tryndamere into the comp you listed now and then and then whine on the forums.

> [{quoted}](name=cocacolalips,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Tg9gZAal,comment-id=000500000000,timestamp=2016-08-09T16:07:36.759+0000)

Exept there's less of a chance of being rolled into a comp that has 2-3 Aram top picks, and more of a chance that I'll be squaring off against a yorick. 

Soraka can keep her team alive in a game mode without much healing available. Pretty game breaking if you ask me.

Soraka healing is deceiving. Unlike other healers, she isn't healing sh!t. She is trading some of her health for some of your health. If you have 100 health and she has 100, she heals you once, she now has 50 and you have 150. The amount of health between the two of you hasn't changed and is still 200.

She is useless against anything that isn't a team of 5 melee champions, and even then, since she can't fight, chances are you will get stomped every teamfight.

There is a reason she has a rock bottom 40% winrate in ARAM. She sucks as much as Tryndamere. Go figure.

While i agree Soraka's pretty underwhelming in ARAM, I have to downvote you here. Soraka might not be as great a healer due to the effects of ARAM, but she's in no way a worse champ in general. In fact, when building offensively she's potentially more powerful than in SR. I've had Soraka teammates that've not just dominated fights but carried *games*. Since her heals are less powerful, it makes sense to not build supportively...and with AoE slows and silences, with the second also having a root, plus a global heal that gains more power depending on the current health of your allied champs, you can use your abilities more for utility instead of support. And if you still want more damage on your abilities and heal power for her W/R, you can always go Hybrid...which is less successful than AD but still gets the job done with your allies' help.

This discussion is about ARAM. Thank you.

> which is less successful than AD 

Am I blind or are you suggesting I should play AD Soraka. Are you a troll.

Have you seen the damage AD Soraka can do in ARAM? Not being a troll, I'm being serious. Trinity Force is a mean item when used right, and there's so many other items you can use like Bloodthirster or BotRK for lifesteal. Statikk Shiv is an obvious item as well, Phantom Dancer for defense, etc. If you don't believe me, experiment once you get the chance to play her in ARAM. Hell, she's a mean counterpick against Riven in SR if you know what you're doing.

AD soraka can be played if the rest of your team is AP and are better champs than soraka. Her AA are just like (or worse than) any other champs, there's no particular reason to go AD but it's better than a 5 AP comp which gets stomped by the OP mres items (locket, abyss, maw) that everyone can build.

The best build for soraka is without a doubt tanky mage. The combination of health regen (Guardian's horn is awesome for her) and AP makes her heals pretty good actually. Rod of ages is an amazing first time because it gives sustain to both mana and health. Depending on the teams, you can choose for a more AP oriented build with deathcap or more regen oriented with warmogs, locket and visage (mainly against AP poke comps).
rofl

no, because this is literally happening every game.

Just for an example, my ARAM enemy teams last night (around 1300 MMR in ARAM):

game 1: katarina, taliyah, lux, poppy, amumu
game 2: blitzcrank, lee sin, amumu, annie, heimer
game 3: sivir, jinx, annie, blitzcrank, ori
game 4: gp, jhin, lulu, lee sin, ziggs

Notice how in EVERY SINGLE ONE OF THOSE GAMES there is at least 1 if not 2 S tier ARAM picks? This is what's going on in ARAM right now, every single game. That's not even counting the number of times champs were on my team (zyra and ori twice, blitzcrank twice, lee sin, amumu, gp, ziggs, lulu, lux, etc: all from the same pool as the enemy champs above). It's BORING. And this is after 2-3 dodges before each game.

If you were to take 5 players with all 131 champions unlocked, It would mathematically likely that one of those players is going to roll one of the top 20% of aram champions. In other words, if you were to divide a dart board into 5 slices, BLINDFOLD 5 people and have them throw their dart until it hit the board, one of those 5 would typically hit the OP champions slice of the dart board (in other words the top 26 Aram champions; 131/5=26.2)
Or, you could do what people are doing all over the place and just unlock the top 26 OP ARAM champions. Then their chances are 26 out of 36 to account for free week. Do you see the problem?

Or you could get good at the game and stop whining on the forums.

The fact that your MMR is 1300 and the "aram accounts" you are facing are also 1300 show that aram accounts aren't all that good otherwise you would not be facing them in the first place.

I'm sorry, but when I say "ARAM only accounts have a 26 out of 36 chance of choosing an S tier champ while I have a 26 out of 131 chance and that's unfair" and your response is "get good" it shows a distinct disconnect. I still win ARAM games all the time, it's just **super boring** to play against the same champions over and over again. People still suck at the game just like in SR, and I have experience playing a large portion of the cast (and it only takes me 2 games to get a reroll) so, whatever. But it's really, really boring to play against a poke mage automatically every single game because the enemy team has at least one guy who only owns poke mages.

PLEASE. Something has to be done about all the **BS** ARAM only accounts. They also need to make it so if you dodge in ARAM lobby, you still get the same champion as you had in the previous lobby next time. 

SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO sick of ARAM only accounts and people dodging in lobby because you wont trade them your Lux
the problem is that it takes all of like 5 hours of play time to make a "new" ARAM account. So dodging penalties will never fix the problem.
Dodging penalties should require your account logged in so that you can't avoid the punishment while on a smurf account.
oh absolutely, I agree. but until that happens any increased dodge penalties are meaningless.
True. ARAM already has a longer penalty than other modes, but it's ineffective.

Allow chests and key frags on champions that you don't own, then I am for this totally. I hate playing a match where I can't get a chest/key frag all because I don't own the champion. I dodge more games due to getting a champ I don't own than getting a champ I own and hate playing as.

> Allow chests and key frags on champions that you don't own

I agree with this. Hextech crafting completely undermines the purpose of free week champs. If you would try out a free week champ now, you'll feel bad because you can't get a chest/key. You can get mastery points for them but no chests. That makes little sense.

Why would Riot make it possible for people to go play champs they dont own? Do you not see how that will cost them money?

If they give you the whole champ pool and you only play ARAM you will never need to spend RP or IP on champs.

Like free week rotation, why would Riot ever do that? Are they stupid?

If you mean "entire champ pool" as in "all champs each ally owns", then I agree 100%
Note I left out the F2P Champs because there's really no reason why that has to be a thing in ARAM...if they're already going to make us play Champs we don't own, then why not just do those our allies have so we can actually switch freely with each other if we're set up with each others' Champs?

> Note I left out the F2P Champs

except f2p champs are already options in ARAM lol
I know, I said "there's no reason why that has to be a thing in ARAM"

If you get set up with F2P weekly champs and you share the champion pool of your allies
Then it necessarily follows that you'd be able to switch champions with any teammate no matter what even if the option is left in.

That's true, except there's far less of a chance that your allies know how to play the Champ if it's F2P. No matter what, if they don't have the champ already it's likely they'll feel far less confident using it. Even more so if they're not in the mood or other variables that in retrospect don't have any place in this conversation but should be mentioned anyhow.

ARAM is not about comfort picks, though. The main reason to play this game is when you feel like playing something that you haven't played in a while.

Sometimes I get bored playing champs that I play in ranked. But when I'm in a draft pick and looking for a fun champ to pick, I usually keep scrolling up and down indecisively. In ARAM, you get a champ and you just play with it. You don't have second thoughts because you know that it's purpose of the game mode and games are fairly short.
I say it in ARAM.  I hate getting a free champ that I have no interesting in playing, and thus I have never unlocked.

But don't you want to unlock every champion eventually? I don't just unlock champions that I want to play. I also buy FOTM champs because I know that it's likely that my team wants to pick it so I can trade with them.

It sucks that ARAM conflicts with ranked in this way.

Do I want to unlock every champ eventually?  Not necessarily.  Even if ARAM weren't a part of the equation, owning champs that I don't want to play also potentially leads to getting skins for them when receiving mystery skins.
mystery skin just says "unowned skin", not "unowned skin for unlocked champ". I'm unsure of how it actually works tho.

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752934-Mystery-Gifting-FAQ

Look under "What skins are eligible for mystery gifting?"  It says, "A skin for any Champion that your friend owns is eligible..."
No, I really don't want to unlock every champion. I would guess at least 1/2 the champions that have been released have 0 appeal to me.

Riot - if you want to make $$$ on ARAM - allow during champ select for the option to BUY the champ if you don't own it.  We all know they will NEVER allow you to get the Key or Hex box on the champs you do not own, so... RIOT - give us the option to unlock the champ if we want to.
Well, I can actually see this as a legitimate stance for people in OFA, because if you play a champ you don't own and get an S rank, well, no chest for you, sorry, didn't pay dat IP preemptively.
